Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Excelent staff, reazonable price”
Reviews.Author: m_piacentini
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife been at this property on 2011, and for lack of time i forgot to let my contribution to Tripadvisor about this good place. We came from Brazil to discover the wonders of the Eternal City, booked the hotel online based upon the Tripadvisor reviews. The property is very nice for the price, considering that in Rome everything is extremely expensive, especially hotels, this one is affordable, but with plenty of quality. The room was clean, spacious, fully carpeted. The bathroom had a nice size, and was equipped with hairdryer, augmentation mirror (which my wife loved), bathtub, and plenty of towels, which was good. The hotel staff was always helpful and helped a lot with directions and tips. the breakfast was good, but with a buffet composed with 90% of sweets, wich obliged us to do some shopping in the grocery store around the corner in order to eat something salty on the breakfast, but this was not a big deal. the property is placed a few blocks away from subway, and have a nice cantina and a gelatteria (for ice cream) next to it, at the street corner. All in all is a good hotel, and we most probably will stay there again when back to Rome in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, great bathroom, clean and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: pbirdie3
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay for 3 nights as parents with our college student. Room was very well done, clean and high ceilings. Bathroom was great with a very large tub and shower. The Lepanto metro stop is probably 5 blocks away. Convenience store 1 block away. Staff was very friendly and helpful with maps and attractions/directions. Great street market 1 block away to shop and for fruit/vegetables/produce. Felt like a safe area to be in. Wifi was free in the room. They sroed our luggage for 6 hours until we left, but only at the front desk. I asked if they had a luggage room to secure it and she said no. Nothing was stolen, but leaving it by the front desk didn't excite me. Would definitely stay here again. Goog value for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “friendly well run hotel”
Reviews.Author: bob13159
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in late oct, easy to find from Lepanto metro station (5 mins walk) room very clean and well equiped (Equivalent to premier inn) ask to stay in upper floor away from lift, we had room 404. Breakfast is fine with bread, boiled eggs, cereals, pastries,fruit, more than enough to start your day. Reception staff very good, friendly, helpful and forthcoming with advice. We arrived at 1130 and were still allowed to book in to our room and on last day allowed to leave luggage in reception. There is a lounge and bar which although not greatly used was well layed out. There is a mini bar but is quite expensive. Location was in a nice area with a few restaurants and bars within 5-10 mins walk, rome is not cheap but then again you can still eat out for 15-25 euros each depending on wine etc Free map in foyer and Vatican is 10-15 mins walk and 30 mins to spanish steps. Bus 30 takes you to Collusium area and runs every 20 mins or so. Only used metro to get to Termini station as you see so much by walking and getting bus. Only one negitive point about hotel and this is common to a lot of hotels is the charge for internet access which is 2e for 30 mins and 5e per 24 hrs which in this day and age should be free as a benefit to the customer. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Zachster - SA”
Reviews.Author: Zachsta
Reviews.Content: Was a total pleasure, close to the metro and bus stop literally on the exit of the building, we where skeptical initially as we booked this little gem from the reviews we read on here but took our chances and spent 15 days of pure satisfaction in a a room big enough and very clean, to our contentment it was a stunning old building exactly what we had in mind when deciding to go on holiday in Italy. The most pleasant, helpful staff that are always willing to be of assisatnce no matter what time of day or night it is. The Vatican is around the corner and different suburbs are like 2 mins away via the Metro. I will definitely go back here and will suggest this as a place to anyone that wants to feel like they are at home even though they miles away. Thank you to all at Hotel Delle Vittorie for an amazing, affordable stay!!! Zach and Marnie - South Africa!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, quiet location.”
Reviews.Author: citizen66
Reviews.Content: This hotel is convenient to the Vatican and the Rome metro. The staff were very helpful and the rooms well presented and clean. A light breakfast was included in our room rate and was adequate especially as we were short on time. The hotel is located on a quiet back street about 10 minutes from the A metro line so about 25 minutes from the central district. There are a few good restaurants in the immediate area and a few shops. The Vatican is about 20 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “great small hotel in quiet area on bus route”
Reviews.Author: heathraven
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with the position of this hotel. 280 bus stops 1 minute away. 20 minute walk to Vatican. 5/10 minute walk to Metro. Super bars and restaurents nearby offering much better value than "touristy" areas. Lovely peaceful atmosphere after bustle of sites! V helpful staff, breakfast included, room big and spotlessly kept. Great value

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price, good area, breakfasy included”
Reviews.Author: magalie c
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice: big room, nice breakfast, nice area. A little bit far for main attractions but there are buses at few minutes and a subway station (lepanto) at 5 minutes by walk. We paid 3 nights and got 1 night free. The breakfast is included, internet free and employees speak french, english at least Rome city is wonderful

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: IonutDragu
Reviews.Content: This is a good location for a family city break vacation. It`s placed in a quiet area with friendly staff. We found our room clean and with no surprises. Te bathroom was also clean and the room cleaning service was impeccable. The breakfast was quite good with plenty of things to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marija15
Reviews.Content: I visited Rome especially to attend a concert at the stadio olimpico so this hotel's location was perfect for me but although it is not right in the center of Rome it wasn't that difficult to travel and visit the main attractions that Rome have to offer.Hotel is ok we had a pleasant stay here hotel and rooms are clean and staff is very helpful the breakfast(continental) is ok the only thing that I didn't like was that you have to ask every single morning to get some ham and cheese(hotel managers please note with a little effort you can arrange this little minus at breakfast the excuse that you don't display the ham & cheese just to keep them fresh is not that credible) another little minus is that you have to pay for wifi in your room in my opinion this should be free of charge.All in all as I sad it was a pleasant stay here thanks to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “I was a little disapointed”
Reviews.Author: AlexandraBogdan
Reviews.Content: - the internet was not free - there is no luggage room - for breackfast you have to ask for cheese and salami, it's not displayed - the personel is not very frendly

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: SIST
Reviews.Content: nice hotel. I would stay again. Not very central but in a nice area

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel; we enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: VicGreece
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights. The room was spacious and it had a very big and spotless bathroom!!! The breakfast was average. It is a 10 minute walk from the metro station, but we used to walk to the major attractions, since we like exploring a bit of the city we are visiting. The surrounding area is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, friendly staff but a long walk from the attractions”
Reviews.Author: MarkJohns
Reviews.Content: In terms of price I don't think this can be beaten. The hotel was very good value for money and all the staff were very friendly and willing to please. My Italian is non existent! but their English was very good and they were to help me on a number of matters which I would have struggled with otherwise. The rooms are comfortable and the bed was very comfy and the air con worked well. The metro is about 10-15 minutes away and which we did not use as we wanted to walk and get a feel for the city. That said it did mean we did a lot of walking to get to the points of interest. For example the Trevi was about 40 mins walk away. This most probably meant we didn't venture far from the hotel later at night. If I was to visit again I'm sure I would use the Metro more to get around so the points I have made will be less relevant. The breakfast was basic but sustainable. Overall I would recommend if you want a good quality, value for money place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a staff and professionality...”
Reviews.Author: alexagus78
Reviews.Content: Dear all, I would like to highlight the Hotel Delle Vittorie for its special care and professionality offered to us. The staff is excellent, always nice and ready to help and handle any type of situation. We travelled with a big dog (Terranova) who was supposed to attend to a dog competition. They treated her as a person, they gave us a special room where honestly the dog was absolutely perfect. The other rooms are nice and clean, good breakfast, excellent position, close to the metro and right in the center. Good quality service. It should be a 03 stars hotel, believe me, it has nothing to do with other 3 stars hotels in Rome. Well Done!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, good value”
Reviews.Author: Harmothoe
Reviews.Content: Stayed five nights in February 2010. The rooms are comfortable and very functional - my only complaint with the appearance is the unattractive bedspreads. I can see how they're easier to keep clean, but the fabric is really ugly and almost feels like vinyl. Not a big deal, but an eyesore. The bed was surprisingly comfortable, the thermostat worked and noise was not a problem overlooking the street on the first floor. The entire hotel seemed clean and well-maintained. I found the staff to be VERY helpful and friendly. The breakfast is okay as long as your idea of breakfast is breads/sweets, cereal, yogurt, fruit, juice and coffee. Any kind of meat or cheese is extra and expensive. My only hesitation about saying I'd definitely stay here again is the location. It is a short, safe 10 minute walk to the metro, and lots of great places to eat and shop are therefore easily accessible. However, I found the neighborhood restaurants to be very unaccommodating. I wanted to have dinner at the local place they recommended, but no one seemed to speak English and I don't speak enough Italian to function. I ended up going to more touristy areas for meals even though I would have happily eaten near the hotel. It's a very residential area of the city, which can be a good thing, but if you want to eat dinner at 7pm and you don't speak Italian, you may find it challenging. Overall, it's a really good value and if you're spending very little time at the hotel I'd highly recommend it. If you aren't comfortable with depending on the subway to get to places you want to go, you might want to spend more for a hotel closer to the attractions - the neighborhood businesses will be in a much better position to cater to foreigners. If you're not sure what the subway entails... it's very easy to figure out, each trip on it is one euro (or four euros for use all day), and your visit to Rome will be much more manageable if you invest 10 minutes in learning how to do it. Ticket machines do operate in multiple languages and signage telling you where things are is easy to figure out.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Mild Service”
Reviews.Author: shankar2k2
Reviews.Content: Before I speak about the hotel, I want to speak about the area. Slightly north of the major sites but a few blocks walk to the metro. We utilized the metro extensively. Because we were north of the major tourist attractions, we found that dining in that area was very authentic. My wife is of Italian background, and she found the food here fantastic. There was nobody around speaking english at the tables. But the staff at the restaurants usually did. It was quiet and worth the few blocks walk to get to a metro. The hotel experience was not as nice. This poor review is mainly due to the checkin process. I had sent a few emails back and forth before coming to Rome. I was assured to a single large bed. Upon arrival I was told there were no large beds. I assured him of the many emails stating the contrary. In fact I had the date of the last email that had confirmed this. He looked back and found it. I did end up getting the single large bed, but at the expense of being told I was mistaken and blown off. In addition, there was a leak in the shower that was getting the entire floor wet. I told them promptly, but it was not fixed before the end of the 3 night stay. The hotel as a whole was nice. Breakfast was included. I was just a bit put off by the staff's ambivalence.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but too far away from everything.”
Reviews.Author: Lolaloo22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in March 2009. The hotel itself was nice and clean, and the staff was courteous and spoke good English. The room was nothing special but I wasn’t expecting anything spectacular for the price. It was a decent size. There is a fridge in the room which was nice. The breakfast is served in the basement –there are hard boiled eggs, assorted croissants and rolls and Danish, fruit, cereal and juices. It wasn’t great but it was enough to fill you up til lunch and save some money. Note that you have to walk up a flight of stairs to enter the hotel, so it won’t be a good choice for disabled travelers. Also, although this hotel is away from the touristy stuff, it was very noisy on the street because they were doing major construction at the time I was there. The reason I wouldn’t stay here again is simply the location. It is not near anything. Some of the previous reviews say its close to restaurants, etc. but there is only one restaurant nearby on the corner and it was wayyyy over priced. There was also a coffee shop/bar kind of place around the corner a bit, but that was pretty much it. The area is dead after dark. The walk to the metro was too long – took us usually 10-15 minutes to get there. Although on the way to the metro we stumbled upon some fun street fairs and markets that we enjoyed. But after walking all day in Rome, the last thing you want to do is get off the metro and have to walk another 15 minutes to the hotel. Taxis are way too expensive and good luck finding one in the evening in that neighborhood anyway. All in all, this is a decent hotel with good sized rooms in a quiet neighborhood. But next time I will choose a hotel closer to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean, friendly!”
Reviews.Author: AlieS2
Reviews.Content: This was definitely my favorite hotel of the trip. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Pasquale, one of the desk clerks, printed out directions to a Gelato shop for me and made all the arrangements (including a bagged breakfast!) for us when we needed to go to the airport very early in the morning. The rooms was a nice size, clean, and beautifully decorated. The bathroom was also a nice size and the only hotel we stayed at during the trip that had a bathtub. The breakfast buffet had many different options of delicious food. It was less than a block from a bus stop and within walking distance of many restaurants, shops, and a lovely fountain. The only thing I didn't like was that they charged for using the computer. 8 Euro for 15 minutes! Needless to say I did not check my e-mail while in Rome :) Otherwise everything was great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: AnitaFinland
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good value for money. Its quiet and cosy. Bed was good, aircondension alsou. Staff was very helpful to as. Near to the hotel are bar Vanni: they bring lot of small "antipasti" free, when orden bier or wine! : ) Anita Finland

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel not too close to centre friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: EveDawber
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my friend Alison late August for 8 nights. We found the hotel through ebookers and got a great deal. It's a bit of walk to Popolo but good for walking off all that pasta! We got flights with British Airways and the hotel B & B for less than £400 each and were very pleased with it. The staff were extremely helpful especially Luigi. Plenty of restaurants around to choose from so you don't need to eat at the same place twice. Lepanto station is a 10 minute walk away. Would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms for a good price that is close enough to everything but not too close”
Reviews.Author: vgdaddy
Reviews.Content: Great rooms and great service. The breakfast was plentiful and delicious (not the standard bisquits and coffee at other European hotels). It is in a nice neighborhood within walking distance of the Vatican but is not right in the middle of all the touristy commotion in Rome. Highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel in Quiet Area”
Reviews.Author: Laura M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just reurned from a 2 night stay at the Delle Vittorie. We were in Rome last March and Stayed at the Fellini Inn near the Trevi fountain so I thought we would book that again but the prices in September were double what we had paid previously so I spent days looking for somewhere to stay and I found the Delle Vittorie which for £70 a night for a double was excellent value (and half what the Fellini would have cost). Rome is a very expensive city to stay in and for the same price all I could find were B&Bs in the dodgy suburbs sharing a flat with the owners and sharing a bathroom with the other guests to. This hotel is a real find. The Pratti area is a middle class residential area and as such has lovely shops and places to eat. The hotel is a ten minute walk from Lepanto metro which is only a few stops from Termini. We struggled to find the hotel the first night as it is not directly on Piazzale Manzinni but a road behind. Basically it is stright across (180degrees) the square from where you hit the square (Ferrarri) and next door to the Rai tv studios. Theres a gorgeous pasticceria on the square with hundreds of gorgeous cakes and a really nice pizzeria close by. Prices are however more expensive than some of the places in the centre because of the area you are in. I would definately recommend this hotel as it offers good value for money. The rooms are spotless with flat screen tvs, hairdryer, digital safe and bathroms that have a bath and a shower. Breakfast is great by italian standards. Juices, fruit, cereals, cakes, croissants and bread. One tip though is to ask for a cappuccino from the staff as they make you a fresh coffee out back so you can avoid the stewed stuff they have out in the flasks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for the budget traveler”
Reviews.Author: OHARE4ME
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Delle Vittorie immensely. The Hotel was a bit tricky to find; fortunately we had taken a shuttle from the airport that dropped us off at the door. After getting our bearings, we returned easily. The Hotel is clean and our room was large and quiet. The neighborhood is far from the tourist hustle and bustle, which was also welcome. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, stowing our baggage before check in and after checkout and allowing us to use the restrooms. The breakfast was also top notch, with a vast variety of fruit, canned fruit, yogurt, pastries, breads, hard boiled eggs, toast, juices, and coffee. The hotel is found in a convenient neighborhood, a 10 minute walk from the Lepanto metro stop and two or three stops from the Termini station hub. Traveling to all the main sites by metro was extremely quick and simple, as well. The Vatican is no more than a 20 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Loud, LOUD”
Reviews.Author: serg409
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights, and that is all I would ever recommend staying here. Our room was on the fourth floor, in the back of the hotel, and it was LOUD. There was some mechanical pump or something that kept coming on every few hours and would ruin any chance at a good night's sleep, even with the window closed. The staff, although friendly, was completely unable to direct us to a laundromat to get our clothes washed. The internet was way too expensive, so we were able to find an unsecured network that we could link onto when the computer was next to the window. That was helpful. It was about a 10-15 minute walk to the subway. It wasn't entirely a bad experience, except for the noise. If you requested a room at the front of the hotel, I'd imagine you'd have a better experience. It was clean and one of the staff members actually did wind up being helpful. The only other comment I would have is that I did not like leaving the key every time we left and having to go ask for it back. I seemed that there was no security in doing this as someone else could have easily gone up and asked for our room key.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Single Fee!”
Reviews.Author: twikken
Reviews.Content: Important stuff first: we accidentally booked a single through Orbitz and were charged an additional 40 euro per night (yes, my fault but 40 euros is extortion). We were forced to pay the rate of a double room but were unable to switch to a larger room (despite rooms being available). When I attempted to negotiate the rate (95 euros is insanity for the room) we were lead to believe that many people make the same mistake. I would imagine that the advertised rate of 55 euros very frequently is turned to 95 euros at check in. This hotel was traditional European style. Small rooms with recently added bathrooms, 33 rooms, free breakfast downstairs. The mattress was awful and the shower tiny. It's funny that the reviews for service on this place are so hit and miss. The desk manager Marco (who seems to be at the desk most of the time) is friendly but direct. I can see how you could come away from an interaction with him with different ideas about his level of service. We blew a circuit in the room and he was very short with us. The location is not central but we didn't mind the walk. We spent a very nice three hours of the first day walking from the hotel, across the Tiber, and down Via del Corso (the shopping drag) to the forum and Colosseum. It is a 15 minute walk to the Metro but the bus is very close and cabs are cheap and include a free adrenaline rush (there's a cab stand a block away with licensed Roman taxis 24 hours a day). One last thing... we were right on the street but heard NOTHING during our three night stay. Very quiet!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, courteous, and quiet”
Reviews.Author: doctimothy
Reviews.Content: If you are visiting Rome and wish to be away from the noise of the city in a clean hotel and at a reasonable rate, I recommend this hotel. It is located in Vatican City, so you are in walking distance to the Vatican, but you need to take a cab into the city center. My wife and I stayed three days and three nights and only needed a taxi once (we went to the Panthenon square for dinner and walked over to the Trevi Fountain for a relaxing evening: worth doing!). We booked a full day tour to Pompeii and a full day tour (ancient/monumental) of the city of Rome, so we were picked up from the hotel by our tour carrier. The other day we had in Rome, we walked to the Vatican and Saint Peter's Basilica. If you do stay at Hotel Delle Vittorie, definitely walk around the corner to eat at Brasserie Pizza (ask for a menu translated into English - I recommend the Buffalo Cheese Speck Pizza: amazing). The front desk should be able to direct you to it; we found those at the front desk extremely helpful. The rooms are standard for a European hotel - two single beds attached as a double, with a medium sized room and bathroom. (Note: Not a hotel for those looking to experience Roman nightlife).

Reviews.Title: “Not the hotel if you want a city centre location!”
Reviews.Author: jennyw84
Reviews.Content: To get into the centre of Rome from this hotel you have to walk about 15 minutes to the Metro then get on a train. Can take up to 30 mins to get into the centre. I got pick pocketed on our 1st day at the Metro station so beware. The day staff at the hotel are very rude & unhelpful. The night staff are much better but don't speak as much English. The hotel was clean enough & the breakfast was fab but waiting staff are very rude. I found there was a mixture of nationalities staying at the hotel. I would not recommend it to a friend due to it's location, it's too far from the city centre which adds to your travelling costs. I would definitely return to Rome though, fantastic city with lots to do. Make sure you 'shop around' when you go out to eat as restaurants around the tourist areas are very expensive & you can find much cheaper places to eat just around the corner from the dearer places.

Reviews.Title: “Try This Hotel .”
Reviews.Author: RYANKE
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews on this hotel I decided to give it a try. I wasn't disappointed it lived up to all expectations for a hotel of this size. Yes its not in the centre of Rome but its near the Metro, that will get you to all locations.And a nice half hour walk from hotel to the Vatican. I would certainly recommend a stay here again .

Reviews.Title: “Quaint little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zhayynn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Delle Vittorie for 2 nights in April 2008. The hotel was not easy for the taxi driver to locate but eventually found the street. The hotel is located in a very quiet residential neighbourhood and is a 10 minute walk away from the train station and buses. The room was spacious but basic and the toilet was clean and comfortable. There was no restaurant, only a breakfast room where a basic continental breakfast is served. The receptionist doubles as the concierge and was extremely helpful in helping us decide our tours. The lack of a restaurant in the hotel was not a problem as there was a restaurant barely 30 seconds walk on the corner called Vanni's. Excellent italian food! Our one grouse was, being April it was quite warm and the rooms had no air-conditioners (apparently they provide them only in 'summer').

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: wethreeboys
Reviews.Content: A little off the beaten path but, once we figured out the metro it was no problem, it was a nice 10 minute walk to the station. Was most disappointed to find that it was 8 euro an hour to use there wifi or 20 euro for 24 hours that is a real rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy hotel in authentic area”
Reviews.Author: Jukeboxx
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel in March 2009 and we would definitely return here in the future (that is if what they say about Trevi'c coin tossing was true, of course :) Firstly, the location is great. Even though there are probably cheaper and more numerous hotels in Termini area aimed at budget travelers, I'm very glad we chose the Prati area. The subway is at about 15 minutes walk on a quiet and real Roman neighborhood (hardly any tourists there, which is awesomely peaceful when returning home in the evenings, after being intoxicated with camera flashes and noisy high school kids all day long...) The front desk staff is helpful enough and they make you feel you can approach them on any problem you might have. The room we got was quite large for European standards, decorated with pictures from the times when the building was an aristocratic point, while the bathroom was on the same level of appreciation. The only downside is that the breakfast room is quite small, but given the fact that there are only about 30 rooms in the hotel, congestion wasn't really a problem. Breakfast was ok, don't expect too much meat and cheese though - there's mostly sweet stuff , croissants and eggs. Nevertheless, you can absolutely get your fill for about 4-5 hours of walking and visiting. All in all, choosing hotel Delle Vittorie was a small "vittoria" for us (vs Termini creepy area) and we highly recommend it for all type of travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: trio71
Reviews.Content: I can't really praise this hotel enough. The location is a little way out of town (a brief Metro ride then a 10 minute walk) but as long as you realise this it's absolutely fine. Neighbourhood is quiet (we had the windows open all night) and feels safe... as mentioned by an earlier reviewer it's full of locals going about their daily business, rather than hoards of tourists. In fact the walk to the Metro station became one of the interesting highpoints of each day. Desk staff were extremely friendly throughout our stay. The room itself was extremely clean, with fresh bedding and towels daily. It had clearly been (re?)decorated quite recently. Sky TV was a nice touch too, for winding down before bedtime... a hint - on many channels you can get English audio on dubbed US programmes by pressing the information button and choosing "Inglese". Breakfast was great - loads of fresh pastries, fruit, cereals, rolls etc, and the staff were extremely helpful. Coffee was a bit stewed, but you can't have everything! If we ever go back to Rome we'll almost certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful !”
Reviews.Author: sabres00
Reviews.Content: After talking to a few friends about taking the train, my Mom and I decided to board the Leonardo Express from FCO airport, then tranfer to the Metro, and Finally get off at the Lepanto stop and walk from there. The walk from the metro was only about 10 minutes, and we saved A LOT of money by avoiding a taxi. The hotel is on a quiet street which is wonderful, we got a great nights sleep every night. The front staff is very helpful, and spoke excellent english. Only downside- DO NOT go to the restaurant they recommend, the food was TERRIBLE, just stick with the small pizza places that are in the area. Our room it self was small, but perfect for what we wanted. The shower had hot water and we had fresh towels every day. The breakfast was a lot bigger than I was expecting. They had fresh juice and a nice dessert spread daily, the hours were perfect, we just woke up, ate and left. Like I said earlier, the Metro is the way to go, we made it to all the hot spots, even Ostia Antiqa (sp) for only 16 Euro for the week! Cant beat that. The walk to the metro was only about 10 mins, and we passed by open air markets, and even found a grocery store where we stocked up on water and chips at. Overall we had the best time, and I would definately stay at this hotel again and again.

Reviews.Title: “A good find in Roma”
Reviews.Author: Dol123
Reviews.Content: This is a very good find. Very clean hotel. Excellent reception staff and always helpful Although I would recommend NOT eating in the trattoria they recommend. The hotel is slightly out of city centre but that wasn't a problem for us as we are always prepared to walk.The hotel is located on a quiet street, nearest metro is Lepanto ( about 10 mins walk away). Breakfast was adequate, plenty of it and each morning they replenished the cakes and rolls. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great location.”
Reviews.Author: aamoun
Reviews.Content: nice clean hotel, the staff were helpful so as the breakfast . I was so pleased with the hotel location just a few minutes from vatican and easy access to centre Rome. loved it aamoun

Reviews.Title: “Great value, quiet neighbourhood hotel, best for active walkers”
Reviews.Author: NorthSands
Reviews.Content: This quiet little hotel, found on the internet at an astoundingly good-value price, met all of our expectations for a quiet neighbourhood base a little outside of the centre of Rome. Located in the Prati district, tucked away just off the Piazza Mazzini, the hotel is easily found if you check the exact map location online beforehand. We found our room clean and comfortable - not huge, but perfectly adequate for the limited amount of time we were spending in it (and our bathroom was spotless). We particularly liked the high-ceilinged elegance of this converted former private residence. The front desk staff were welcoming, helpful & spoke good English. The breakfast room (no restaurant) was bright & cheerful, and offered a good range of morning rolls, pastries, cereals, fresh & tinned fruits, juices, yoghurt & hard-boiled eggs to set you up for the day. There is also a variety of cafe/bars in the streets within a few minutes walk. In the evenings we dined out in some excellent and welcoming little neighbourhood restaurants, full of locals and not tourists - we particularly liked the great atmosphere and good value Roman menu of Ristorante Candido (about 10 minutes walk to the northwest on Viale Angelico, 275/277) and the more upmarket but pricier fish & Sardinian specialiaties on offer at Portorotondo Ristorante (just round the corner from the hotel at Via Oslavia, 33). The hotel is about 10 minutes walk from the nearest metro (Lepanto on line A) and 20-25 minutes walk from the Vatican, or from the northern end of the city centre (Piazza del Popolo). If you are reasonably fit and active and enjoy walking you can reach and explore all the major central sights on foot in the course of a day or two, with the cheap & efficient metro there to whisk you quickly back again in the evening. This was our first visit to Rome and Hotel Delle Vittorie was a perfect solution for our needs. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved being by the markets and the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: CAnn9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed this hotel because it was clean, had a great breakfast, had a nice restaurant next door and was close to both the Vatican as well as the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing retreat”
Reviews.Author: BindyB
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at this hotel and were very happy. The rooms were impeccably clean, the front desk personnel spoke excellent English and the continental breakfast was great. We loved the area, it was a lovey residential neighborhood. There were cafes and restaurants in easy walking distance. It was about a ten minute walk to the metro and about twenty minutes to the Vatican. I would strongly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: BookloverAZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights for our 10th anniversary. We are Americans and speak very little Italian. Front desk staff spoke English, and they were very helpful to us. Hotel is very charming, good size room and bath with air conditioning. We had window that opens up to views and fresh air. Continental breakfast was complete and delicious. We had easy access to the Metro, bus and Vatican City. The neighborhood is very nice, we felt very safe there, even walking the streets after dark. Good shopping and restaurants within walking distance. I loved this hotel and would stay there again. The Americans in Rome - Phoenix, AZ

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AlanPam654
Reviews.Content: We booked our accommodation in Rome via the internet based on the published reviews The Hotel was perfect for us, clean and comfortable and just far enough away from the centre of Rome to get some respite from 'the madding crowd' It was very convenient to have an adequate breakfast before heading off for the day The staff all spoke English and went above and beyond on every occasion The local coffee shops were welcoming and it wass good to sit and watch the world go by Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: katolet
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about booking this as it was a birthday present for my boyfriend and I didn't know what to expect. Like most people I looked on here for reviews but it's not until you get there yourself that you truly know if it's right. We were very pleased with the hotel, the staff were extremely helpful and they do go out of their way if they can. The rooms were nice and tidy. The location is good with only a 10/15 minute stroll to the metro. We had a few complaints about the location, we didn't find any restaurants or bars in the immediate area. The hotel recommended one restaurant which was fantastic and one that I would recommend call the Brassiere which the locals dine at so that's always a good sign (ask the hotel). Before I went people wrote on here saying that the Vanni restaurant was the place to go but we found it awful for food but great for ice cream!! The tour to Pompeii is worth doing and worth the money if you don't mind being in a coach for a few hours which you can book at the hotel. Overall it was great, Rome's very expensive, but seeing the ruins and the sites made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic Experience”
Reviews.Author: acsbaltimore
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon which was also our first time in Europe. We both loved it! The staff was friendly and helpful. The room and bathroom were clean and much bigger than any of the other hotels we stayed in elsewhere it Italy. The breakfast was fantastic. The neighborhood is busy with people going to and from work during the day but quiets down a bit at night. The metro is really close. While there are several great restaurants and bars in the immediate area there isn't much 'nightlife.' However, we ate dinner most nights within walking distance of the hotel and we never had trouble grabbing a table for a late drink after dinner. It is definitely not a touristy area, no traps, just a genuine, modern area with Italians going about their everyday lives.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for the budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: Crina S
Reviews.Content: i have booked this hotel based on these reviews and it was great. I loved the location, it was great to see old italian guy walking the dogs in the morning and people going to work in the morning. The neighbourhood made me feel like a local not a tourist The Lepanto metro very convenient. On the way to the metro on Sunday a small antiques market, great to stroll for 10 minutes. The breakfast was great, the room was spottless clean, everything was as we had expected. I will go back anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, off-the-track location”
Reviews.Author: Kakpraat
Reviews.Content: We booked our room at the Hotel Delle Vittorie through Easyjet's new holiday website. We got a really good rate and at first I was sceptical. After reading through the other reviews on Trip Advisor about the hotel we decided to go ahead and book, and I'm glad we did. The hotel itself is situated in a quiet area just north of the Vatican and a 5 - 10 min walk from the Lepanto metro station. I thought the location was great because it's nowhere near being touristy and slap bang in the middle of a quite well-to-do Roman suburb. There are great little restaurants and gelaterias within easy walking distance from the hotel. You could also walk to Piazza de Popolo within about 10 - 15 minutes. The hotel staff were friendly and all spoke excellent English. We arrived too early to checkin (checkin was at 2pm and we arrived at 12:30pm) but the hotel were more than happy to look after our bags for us until we came back at 2pm. They had a secure lockup for the bags and used a baggage tag system with a receipt to ensure they gave you back the correct bag. When we arrived back at 2pm they had even taken our bags up to the room from the lockup which were waiting for us in the room. The room was clean and the bed and linen were fresh. The only complaint was the bathroom which was a little musty but bearable. The windows of our room overlooked the road outside the front of the hotel and even with the window open we could hardly hear a thing. The TV was a small portable colour one with about 10 channels. The only English channels were MTV, CNN and Euronews. There was a Spanish channel called TVE, a German channel, and all the rest were Italian. Breakfast was excellent, a good variety of the usual continental suspects. Cereals, croisants, yoghurts, strong coffee, fruit, etc. were all to be found and the breakfast room was clean and comfortable. We checked out at 9am on our last day the hotel were more than happy to keep our bags for us which we collected at about 4pm later that day without any problem. All in all, a great 3 star hotel for the money and I would definitely recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous break!”
Reviews.Author: blakefamily
Reviews.Content: went to rome on a two night break and had a great time. the weather was perfect. managed to see many of the major tourist sites. the hotel was very clean and comfortable and the staff very helpful. everyone we met spoke english and were quite happy to speak it. the hotel is located in a quiet district but its not too far from the vatican and this is a pleasant walk to reach. otherwise the metro is about a ten minute walk away. we enjoyed it so much here we have already booked to go back in March next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: kristyw
Reviews.Content: This is a really good hotel for the money, and compared to other hotels. Its not as central as some but is not far out either. 10 minutes walk max to the Lepanto metro station and then only 2 stops to Spagna which is the Spanish Steps and all the shops. Very good reception staff, no problem to book us a taxi to the airport on our return. Rooms are clean and tidy, bathroom ponged a bit but OK otherwise. The metro is a bit rank, and not particularly user friendly when compared to the ease of the London underground but is also not hard to use. Found Rome airport extremely disorganised, over an hour to check in on our BMI Baby flight when we'd go there over 2 hours before the flight. They're sooooo slow. Also, be prepared for frustrations at the Colleseum (dunno how to spell it!), the queue was only about 40 mins but its chaos as you get to the ticket booths.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel! Excellent Value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Vicki01
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from out first visit to Rome. We stayed at the Hotel Delle Vittorie for 4 nights after reading the reviews and it was as the reviews said - excellent and good value for money. The staff were very friendly, spoke excellent english and were so helpful at all times. Breakfast was excellent. Served till 10 - Coffee, fruit, croissants, cereals & cold meats, breads etc - the staff will make you a cappacino if you ask - it was lovely before a day of sightseeing. The room was a good size, the bathroom was clean and also of a good size. Room was cleaned every day, with a change of linen and towels. Air conditioning was a blessing - Rome was boiling & to escape the heat of the day into our room was bliss. Location ok if you don't mind a 30 - 40 minute trot into the centre (getting the metro is ok during the day but the A line stops running in the evening - so if you get a late flight into Rome (unless you can figure out the buses from Termini) get a cab, it wasn't too bad at 30euros). The hotel is a bit further out but that sometimes gives an opportunity to see more of Rome you might not otherwise see. If you want a hotel near the stadio olimpico for sports or concerts (we went to see George Michael) this is perfect!! The stadium is about 20 minutes walk up the road. If you stay here just near the hotel is a restaurant called VANNINI - give it a try, it is on the doorstep of the hotel, food is excellent, staff were great and it won't burn a hole in your pocket. It's a favourite with the locals which is always a good sign :-) Would definately stay there again, would probably use the metro more to save the trot back after a day sightseeing though! Quick tip - if you visit the Vatican museum, DO NOT eat at the restaurants directly opposite the exit - No matter how weary you are - 2 pizzas at 8euros each cost us 35euros! Drinks with sky high prices bumped it up!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, but quite far out!”
Reviews.Author: katherine981
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our first visit to Rome. Picked the hotel as it had good reviews and we were not disappointed. The room was clean and the bathroom was HUGE! The bed was slightly hard however. The staff were friendly, spoke really good english and were helpful when we had a problem with the shower. The breakfast had a good choice and was nice and fresh. The ony criticism would be the distance. As we quickly found out, public transport (especially the metro) is limited and the hotel is at least a 10 min walk from the nearest station, which is not what you need when you have spent the day walking everywhere else around Rome! Also, the metro line stops at 9pm for work until 2008, so there is a bus service to get you back. It took a long time to find where the bus stops actually were to start with and there were only a few so again it was a long walk to get to them. Would recommend hotel as a cheap way of visiting Rome, but just be prepared for the walk!

Reviews.Title: “Rome in Winter”
Reviews.Author: neillo336
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Delle Vittorie in Feb, got a taxi from airport using Bobs taxis about £65 return very prompt, but knowing what we know now would not hesitate in getting bus to termini then metro to leapanto, then 10 min walk, the metro is so easy and cheap just get ticket from machine 1 euro each get line A train to Berbatini, it stops at trevi fountain, spanga, but for Delle Vittorie hotel you need to get off at Leapanto which is 6th stop from termini, leave station turn right and hotel is about 10 min walk. The hotel was very clean and rooms were just like pictures shown on website , breakfast was basic but again very clean, the hotel is a little lifeless on evening but we found good bar for eating and drinking called Vanni 50m from hotel, their is also a spar within 200m which by Rome standards is cheap. Rome itself was everything we thought it would be, best for us was the forum which is free, went to vatican arrive early as we got there at 9 am and still had 2 hour wait plus in winter it closes at 1.45 pm, if going to colloso get ticket from palatine hill then when you go to collosium you will not have to que, trevi fountain also good you can get to all these places and more for 1 euro on metro just go to station and get ticket and your away. Bad points for us was the traffic, and not been able to speak much italian struggled with menus as most are not in english, if i went again i think it is important to learn a few basic words as i think this will help alot, also airport allow yourself plenty of time at airport as there is long ques in passport control and security checks all in all i would not hesitate in booking this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you don't mind a fair bit of walking”
Reviews.Author: lindalouLinolnshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delle Vittiorie from 30th Jan- 2nd Feb 2007. We got a coach from the airport from "termani" which is in the centre of the City and as we didnt know where the hotel was we decided to get a taxi.. beware.. the ride was only about 15mins and we were charged £30... we were about a 20 walk from the train station and once we got our bearing we spent the time on the train of bus, both very cheap and easy. If you don't mind walking to the train station then this hotel will be fine, it was clean and the reception staff were particularly friendly and helpful. The breadkfast was the ususal when abroad, bread cheese and ham really. We loved Spagna and the surrounding area for meals and drinks.. they say you will never walk as much as you will in Rome and that is so true.. Take your trainers and bath salts as if anything like us (and we are only young), you will get alot of exercise with all the walking to the different attractions. Would def recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Haris_L
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed at Rome for 3 nights at Delle Vittorie Hotel, from 1st of July until 4th of July. The room was very clean, with nice furnitures, air condition, TV and minibar. The breakfast was very good. The hotel is at a quiet road near Piazza Mancini(north of Vatican city). The metro station is about 10min by foot, so you can go to any place of historical centre of Rome easily. Also has a bus stop next to hotel, where you can catch a bus to Trastevere.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We can truthfully say the hotel is better than most 4 star hotels we have been to never mind 3 star. The Hotel was immaculately clean, staff couldn't be more helpful (we even had little Easter Eggs on our cups and saucers on Easter Sunday morning) and their European breakfast was nice especially for someone with a sweet tooth like me. The staff recommended a great restaurant around the corner where the manager was very welcoming (he sat down at the table with you for a few minutes!), the food was excellent, prices were fair and the atmosphere was great too. It isn't the most central, however The Vatican is a 20 Min walk away, Castel Sant' Angelo is a 15 minute walk, and it is very easy to get to most other places with the Metro.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Delle Vittorie
HotelInfo.Address: Col di Lana 24 | Prati, 00195 Rome, Italy
